meanings.definition: A small, short-handled axe for use in one hand.
meanings.sent1: He used a hatchet to chop wood for the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack carried his trusty hatchet wherever he went.
meanings.sent3: The tiny elf tried to lift the heavy hatchet, but it was too big for him.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sharp hatchets, cutting through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming hatchet reflected the sunlight as he swung it.

meanings.definition: To cut or shape with a hatchet.
meanings.sent1: She carefully hatchets the branches to make them fit in the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor hatchets away at the block of wood to reveal the hidden figure within.
meanings.sent3: He hatchets the cake into perfect slices, each one exactly the same size.
meanings.sent4: Time hatchets away at our memories, shaping them into stories we tell ourselves.
meanings.sent5: The chef hatchets the vegetables with precision, creating a beautiful dish.
